meanings.definition: A heavy base supporting a statue or vase.
meanings.sent1: The plinth held up the tall statue in the museum.
meanings.sent2: The marble plinth was sturdy enough to support the heavy vase.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to climb onto the plinth and knocked over the vase.
meanings.sent4: The plinth stood strong like a loyal friend, always there to support the statue.
meanings.sent5: The plinth, like a reliable rock, never wavered in its duty to hold up the statue.

meanings.definition: A square block at the base of a column.
meanings.sent1: The plinth at the bottom of the column was made of smooth stone.
meanings.sent2: The ancient pillars were each supported by a sturdy plinth at their base.
meanings.sent3: The plinth looked like a tiny castle tower at the foot of the column.
meanings.sent4: The plinth, like a loyal guard, protected the column from any harm.
meanings.sent5: The plinth stood firm, a silent sentinel at the base of the column.

meanings.definition: A platform used as a stage.
meanings.sent1: The actors gathered on the plinth before stepping onto the stage.
meanings.sent2: The plinth was decorated with colorful lights for the performance.
meanings.sent3: The plinth felt like a magical elevator taking the actors to the stage.
meanings.sent4: The plinth, like a secret doorway, led the performers to the spotlight.
meanings.sent5: The plinth shone brightly, beckoning the actors to begin their show.
